db:abstract.db:para: This type was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: accept : bool
db:section.db:para: Set to true to accept incoming client connections when the server is listening. When set to false, incoming connections are rejected. By default, connections are accepted.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] errorString : QString
db:section.db:para: The stringified error message in case an error occurred.

db:section.db:title: host : QString
db:section.db:para: The host address of the server. By default, localhost is used.

db:section.db:title: listen : bool
db:section.db:para: Set to true when the server should listen to client connections or false otherwise. When set to true, the server will listen on the specified url defined by host and port and, when accept is true, accepts incoming client connections. Otherwise the server is closed. By default, the server is not listening.

db:section.db:title: name : QString
db:section.db:para: The name of this server used during the http handshake phase.

db:section.db:title: port : int
db:section.db:para: The port this server is listening on. The value must be in the range 0-65535.
By default, a port is chosen automatically.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] url : QUrl
db:section.db:para: Server url that client WebSockets can connect to. The url uses the ws:// scheme and includes the port the server listens to and the host address of the server.

db:section.db:title: clientConnected(WebSocket webSocket)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when a client connects to this server. webSocket is the newly created WebSocket.
